questions.q: What is the unit of electrical resistance?
questions.explanation: Resistance is measured in Ohms, representing how much a component resists the flow of current.

questions.q: Which component allows current to flow in only one direction?
questions.explanation: A diode acts like a one-way valve for electricity.
A Light Emitting Diode (LED) turns electrical energy into light.

questions.q: Which component is primarily used to store an electric charge?
questions.explanation: Capacitors hold energy in an electric field, often used to smooth out power signals.

questions.q: What is the primary function of a Transistor?
questions.explanation: Transistors are the building blocks of modern electronics, acting as switches.
options: To switch or amplify electronic signals

questions.q: True or False: According to Ohm's Law, Voltage equals Current times Resistance (V = I * R).
questions.explanation: This is the most fundamental formula in electronics.

questions.q: True or False: An Insulator is a material that conducts electricity very easily.
questions.explanation: Insulators (like rubber) prevent electricity from flowing.

questions.q: True or False: A battery provides Direct Current (DC).
questions.explanation: DC flows in one steady direction, unlike the AC from your wall outlet.

questions.q: True or False: If a circuit is 'Open,' current cannot flow through it.
questions.explanation: An open circuit has a break (like an off switch) that stops the flow.

questions.q: True or False: A short circuit is generally a safe and desired event in electronics.
questions.explanation: Short circuits can cause damage or fire because they allow too much current to flow.

questions.answer: A circuit is a closed loop that allows electricity to flow from a power source, through components, and back to the source.

questions.q: Why is a Breadboard useful for students?
questions.answer: A breadboard allows students to prototype and test circuits easily without needing to solder components together permanently.
